title: Regex.hpp:35:31: error: unknown type name 'uint32_t'
body:
**Issue:** Doesn't compile with error from above.

**Test system**
```
System:
  Kernel: 6.12.13_1 arch: x86_64 bits: 64 compiler: gcc v: 13.2.0 clocksource: tsc
  Distro: Void Linux
CPU:
  Info: quad core model: 11th Gen Intel Core i7-1165G7 bits: 64 type: MT MCP smt: enabled
    arch: Tiger Lake rev: 1 cache: L1: 320 KiB L2: 5 MiB L3: 12 MiB
  Speed (MHz): avg: 1389 min/max: 400/4700 cores: 1: 1389 2: 1389 3: 1389 4: 1389 5: 1389 6: 1389
    7: 1389 8: 1389 bogomips: 44851
  Flags: avx avx2 ht lm nx pae sse sse2 sse3 sse4_1 sse4_2 ssse3 vmx
  Compilers: clang: 19.1.4 gcc: 13.2.0 Client: Cinnamon v: 6.4.2 inxi: 3.3.37
```
**Commands run**

```
cmake -B build -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release > CMakeSetup.Clang19.1.4.log 2>&1 && cmake --build build --config Release -j $(cmake -P nproc.cmake) > CMakeBuild.Clang19.1.4.log 2>&1
cmake -B build -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER=/usr/local/llvm/bin/clang -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER=/usr/local/llvm/bin/clang++ > CMakeSetup.CLang21.0.0git.log 2>&1 && cmake --build build --config Release -j $(cmake -P nproc.cmake) > CMakeBuild.CLang21.0.0git.log 2>&1
```

**Fix**
Add missing include statement to `src/Regex.hpp`. 
Possibly `#include <cstdint>`.
author: it-sthoffmann

comments.body: Yeah, my IDE is warning about that, too, but I didn't notice. Man, I hate the implicit includes... Modules are sooooo much better. Thank you so much!

satisfaction_conditions: Identification of the missing header file needed to define uint32_t
A simple, direct fix that requires minimal code changes
Explanation of why the error occurs
